Answer (per-site grand‑canonical mean‑field result; self‑consistent form and a numeric example).

Definitions and mean‑field assumptions
- Let s_j ∈ {0,1} be the indicator that layer j is present at a given site (j = 1..k). Because layers build from the surface, allowed site states are n = 0..k layers with s_j = 1 for j ≤ n and s_j = 0 for j > n.
- Let θ_j ≡ ⟨s_j⟩ be the mean occupation (probability) of layer j (self‑consistent mean‑field variables).
- Use the sign convention that an adsorbed particle in layer j gains energy ε_j (> 0 makes adsorption favorable). Lateral and vertical interactions are attractive and give mean‑field energy contributions proportional to θ’s. Define β ≡ 1/(k_B T).

Per‑site grand partition function (mean‑field)
The grand partition function factorizes over sites in the mean‑field approximation; the single‑site grand partition function is
Xi = ∑_{n=0}^k exp{ β [ n μ + ∑_{j=1}^n ε_j + ∑_{j=1}^n u_j(θ) ] }.
Here u_j(θ) is the mean‑field interaction energy contribution (per occupied layer j) coming from (i) lateral neighbors in the same layer and (ii) vertical neighbors in adjacent layers. A standard double‑counting‑free choice is
u_j(θ) = (z_ℓ/2) ε_ℓ θ_j + (z_inter/2) ε_inter (θ_{j-1} + θ_{j+1}),
with boundary values θ_0 = θ_{k+1} = 0. The factor 1/2 removes bond double counting in the mean‑field estimate.

Self‑consistency for the layer occupations
The θ_j are given by the single‑site probabilities
θ_j = (1/Xi) ∑_{n=j}^k exp{ β [ n μ + ∑_{m=1}^n ε_m + ∑_{m=1}^n u_m(θ) ] }.
This set of k nonlinear equations must be solved iteratively (e.g., start from θ_j^0 and iterate until convergence).

Average number of adsorbed layers per site
The average number of layers per site (per‑site expectation value of n) is
⟨k⟩ ≡ ⟨n⟩ = (1/Xi) ∑_{n=0}^k n · exp{ β [ n μ + ∑_{j=1}^n ε_j + ∑_{j=1}^n u_j(θ) ] }.
This expression together with the Xi and the θ_j self‑consistency equations above gives the mean‑field solution for ⟨k⟩ as a function of μ, ε_j, ε_ℓ, ε_inter, z_ℓ, z_inter and T.

Special (transparent) limits

Xi = ∑_{n=0}^k exp[ β ( n μ + ∑_{j=1}^n ε_j ) ].
